event.title: June Talk Night: What's New in Mobile
event.description:
With both Google I/O and WWDC taking place over the next month, June's meetup seems like the perfect time for us to review all the shiny new things. As usual, we'll have a selection of top notch talks, followed by socialising at a nearby watering hole.

June's event will beÂ held onÂ Tuesday, June 21st at 6:30pm at the offices of cxpartners.

Our lovely speakers for this month are:

â€¢ David Taylor, Somo: What's new in Android

â€¢Â James Frost, Automattic: What's new in iOS

â€¢ Sam Davies, Razeware: iMessage Extensions in iOS 10

â€¢ Andy Barber, Careflow Connect: What's new in Android Studio

ğŸ What will iOS 10 (or perhaps iOS X?) have in store for us? How long will we have to spend fixing our apps to be Swift 3 compatible?

ğŸ¤– Google could bring us some interesting new platforms: Android VR, Project Tango, and Google Chirp (a potential Alexa competitor)

ğŸ­ Will Android N get a sweet new name?

âŒšï¸ Only time will tell what improvements we'll see to Android Wear and Apple Watch

âœˆï¸ If you're not hopping on a plane to California this month, then hop on a bus to SWMobile instead!

ğŸ™‹ğŸ» If you're interested in speaking at this event, please get in touch! You can emailÂ [masked], or send us a message through Meetup.com. We already have one speaker for "What's new in iOS", but we're definitely in need of somebody to cover Android. Or perhaps you'd like to do a short 5 or 10 minute talk on one specific feature? Let us know!
